bill_title: repeal the inheritance tax, to create an inheritance tax reduction fund, and to appropriate certain sales and use tax collections to the fund.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal the inheritance tax, to create an inheritance tax reduction fund, and to appropriate certain sales and use tax collections to the fund. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The provisions of chapter 10-40 do not apply to the transfer of any real or personal property from any person who dies on or after July 1, 2004. Section 2. The inheritance tax reduction fund is hereby created in the state treasury. In fiscal year 2005 and each year thereafter, the interim appropriations committee may transfer moneys available from the inheritance tax reduction fund to the general fund as necessary to replace any reduction in general fund revenues that may be experienced. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be credited to the fund. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund to the inheritance tax reduction fund, an amount equal to twenty-five percent of the increase in sales and use tax revenues in fiscal year 2001 in comparison to fiscal year 2000. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund to the inheritance tax reduction fund, an amount equal to twenty five percent of the increase in sales and use tax revenues in fiscal year 2002 in comparison to fiscal year 2000. Section 5. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund to the inheritance tax reduction fund, an amount equal to twenty-five percent of the increase in sales and use tax revenues in fiscal year 2003 in comparison to fiscal year 2000. Section 6. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund to the inheritance tax reduction fund, an amount equal to twenty-five percent of the increase in sales and use tax revenues in fiscal year 2004 in comparison to fiscal year 2000.
